message.content:
cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.CYBER. 

This paper discusses altmetrics, which are metrics based on social media events related to scholarly communication. The paper presents a framework that describes acts leading to online events on which the metrics are based, and uses citation and social theories to interpret the phenomena being measured. Given the focus on scholarly communication and social media, the most likely sub-category is cs.DL (Digital Libraries). Other likely sub-categories include cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.SOC (Social and Behavioral Sciences), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), and cs.CYBER (Cybersecurity).
